intro: Oenothera fruticosa var. glauca, commonly known as blue ice evening primrose, is a perennial plant native to North America. It is characterized by its silver-blue foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has a woody stem and is often found in dry, sandy soils. It is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Its striking appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
